title: Designing Physical Education Using Nonlinear Pedagogy: Applying the Constraints-Led Approach (CLA)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational theories of physical education pedagogy, principles of motor learning, and basic concepts of instructional design
context.additional_context: Physical education practicum course linked to science curriculum areas (biomechanics, motor learning theory), with project-based assessments including data collection and analysis activities using personal devices

learning_goals: Participants can apply the core principles of CLA (person-task-environment interaction) to actual physical education lesson design
Participants can implement three or more nonlinear instructional strategies that reflect individual learner differences
Participants can collect learner performance data and establish feedback systems using video analysis tools (smartphone/tablet)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
